text: Does anyone know if the MyAccounts Page is available via the API. Would love to add the client information into our dashboard TV's for high-level metrics

working on my first HTML HubSpot template. Is this the kind of stuff I just have to get use to? If I look at the HUBL reference in Design manager it shows blog_topics as deprecated and to use blog_tags. Yet in the docs, there's no mention of blog_tags and still has reference to blog_topics
anyone else finding the caching to be kinda sticky today?
it’s driving me a little nuts. takes like 2 minutes to see my css changes take effect(happening on multiple sites)
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.

ahh yea I agree. I think they need to take on a developer intern and have em every month or so review the documentation in both the HubL reference and the documentation pages and if they don’t know if something is current they need to flag the developer that worked on the feature.

The documentation being incomplete or lagging behind updates has been a consistent issue.

well we're giving it the ole college try. We're your typical web shop where we've always had your standard deployment workflow, development servers, build processes, etc. Our marketing strategist have been telling that's it's better for our customers if we build in HubSpot for tracking purposes, but man it's been an uphill climb.  I just don't see how they can tell me they have a"world-class" cms and really focused on developers over the last year, but have no clear workflow for sandbox and dev workflows. Even the HUBL server is vastly undocumented. 
sorry. just had to vent a little :slightly_smiling_face: thanks for listening.

Our devs that are more used to python ,django, and internal DBs feel similarly - but I think they are coming around as HS adds more and more features for integrating with and developing within the platform. HubSpot has had to be a "Marketer First" platform in order to attract and retain the (huge) SMB market -- consequently, it's had to be easy enough to use but with enough behind-the-scenes capabilities to allow technical marketers to develop interesting and flexible solutions.

I have always appreciated that the HS platform allows someone like myself (who seems to have become better versed  in HubL than Javascript) to set up an end-to-end solution using JUST the interface / built-in tools but that I know I can always extend, twist, bend, and enhance that core setup with nearly any web technology our clients want to throw at it.
I think the sandboxing and developer flows are coming

HS just takes getting used to - once you’ve done a few sites in it and learn some tricks and learn some best practices(often undocumented) you’ll find you can do almost anything on HS you could do with any other CMS. It may take some extra tricks in some cases, but remember you’re not the customer, the marketers are their customers. Using HubSpot gives them a ton of really impressive tools that you can’t get on most platforms. 

Design Manager 2 also solves a lot of the problems us developers have had with the platform

They’re showing that while we’re probably always going to be second class citizens to the marketers, they realize to make the platform truly grow they need developers on board. 

And think about it anyways, Developers should always be second class to the clients themselves.

Who’s the one paying for the work? Who’s the one who’s ultimately responsible for using it?

thanks for the feedback guys. that certainly helps.
and while yes developers aren't the ones paying for it, we're the ones that are depended on to make great sites and to fix broken pieces. and if we are creating hacks and workarounds that aren't user friendly nor are performant, then that's not good either.  
Part of my frustration is that we came to HS because of getting into Growth Driven design (which they tout). Which means to us that there will be constant iterations, constant review of functionality and UX. It was frustrating when I started to build out a site that the process of developing  in sandbox and testing iterations and building on more functionality to a site wasn't that clear.
Anyways, I'm sure i'll get use to it and get onboard. It seems to be a good community and finding this slack channel the other day was a huge relief in itself. Now how to get my dev team onboard... lol
Yes, caching is driving me nuts today. To not have to wait I’m simply putting a query on the page and then incrementing it
<@U6TBZ66FN> ^^
looking.
<@U7SL518D6> also mentioned it above as well.
<@U25C65C3S> I just mash my keyboard every time
?=sdfhfwegwehwhwetrjhfdgrregdgfdfgdfgdfg
Just saw it. If it took 2 minutes, we may have a bug or cloudflare is having an issue.
Longer than 2 multiple times...
Haven’t tried in about 2 hours but have been doing the queries
<@U7SL518D6> Shoot me an URL and the css. I will take a look for why it takes that long.

It’s been intermittent for me but when it starts happening the cache is consistently sticky for like 20 minutes at a time(so for a period of like 20 minutes the cache will take like 2 minutes to reflect changes.)
Same <@U25C65C3S>, give me the CSS, I take a deep look.
Sending you a link momentarily <@U6TBZ66FN>
We have had this issue off and on for a while now, with multiple clients.
Thanks.
Www.Torch.tips
And which css?
Torch.css
Thanks.
Still investigating the issue. In the mean time, I lowered the cache time to 1 minute.

like remington said too - we have a workaround that works too - we increment a url query gets around the cache, it’s just tedious.

Thanks for working on it, know it’s a frustrating thing to troubleshoot
Sorry for the trouble. You don't have to do that if it works as designed. Let's track down the root cause of this.

It’s aiight, we know you guys have been trying to improve the caching and appreciate it.

Cloudflare’s the shit(in the positive tense of the word shit)
is there anyway to force a download from the filemanager URL? for example, on dropbox, you can add `?dl=1` to a url to force a download

<@U2H3TT8F2> on an anchor ```<a href="filemanagerurl" download class="btn-download">Download Malware</a> ```
As far as I know there’s no download query url
it doesnt work in IE
which i mean, hey its not a big deal, but it is something that could cause issues with knowing the user base of the client
valid point. You could add instructions to right click save as - for IE users
for all sane users, they can just click the link and it will work with the download attribute

We were having a batch job sending tons of cache pure requests to cloudflare since yesterday afternoon. It just finished not long ago. So my question is do you experience the caching issue before yesterday (I know must some issue). Is this issue specially bad since yesterday <@U25C65C3S>?
I was able to reproduce this issue earlier. I did not see any particular issue. I just took long time to send the purge. After the batch job finished, I was not able to reproduce.

toward the end of the work day yesterday(5pm cst) I don’t recall having the sticky cache issue, it was happening most of this morning, but I haven’t noticed in in the last few hours.

I’m not certain - but I think it happens only every couple days but seems to be tied to the portals/pages themselves. because some HS sites I wont have the issue on while I am having it on a different one at the same time.

<@U6TBZ66FN> didn’t want to muddy the other caching convo in-case it’s not directly related, but I was wondering - are you guys caching for longer periods of time during off hours for the US?

My boss and I had a big project recently and noticed that the sticky cache issue was happening with more frequency at night. between 7:30pm CST and midnight CST.

We don’t normally work that late so for us we don’t care that much, it was just something we had thought when working .

Anyone have any scripts for a content filter? Trying to sort a case study page into categories, example: <http://697792-hs-sites-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/work>

It's not quite functioning properly, so I am on the hunt for something a little less clunky.
Just noticed it is here. No, we do not cache that way. The issue may still in the cloudflare side. When we send purge request, it may take some time for them to clear the cache.
we usually roll our own - and use data attributes to generate the options for the filters on the fly
Do you have an example?
<@U6TBZ66FN> I personally have only been doing dev work the past 2 days when I had to step in on a project. My other developers said it was worse the past two days but still a nuisance.
Thanks for letting me know. I am planning to add a job to monitor the latency of cache purges.
ok, thank you <@U6TBZ66FN> have a great weekend
